spsRdata 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Impute Missing Values

    impute_var.Rd

    Impute Missing Values

    impute_var(
  data,
  id_site = NULL,
  id_year = NULL,
  id_impute = NULL,
  method = "miceranger",
  n_impute = 5,
  carryforward_yrs = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    data.frame

    id_site

    A site-level variable name included in data.

    id_year

    (Default = NULL). A year variable name included in data. If not specified, assumes the dataset is cross-sectional.

    id_impute

    (Default = NULL) Vector with one or more variable names for which imputation is performed. Imputes all variables that contain missing values in data except id_site and id_year if not specified.

    method

    (Optional. Default = "miceranger") Imputation method. Choose from "carryforward", "amelia", and "miceranger". "carryforward" is available only for time-series data.

    n_impute

    (Optional. Used only when "miceranger" or "amelia" is selected in method. Default = 5) The number of imputed datasets to create (equivalent of argument m in amelia() and miceRanger()).

    carryforward_yrs

    (Optional. Used only when "carryforward" is selected in method. Default = NULL) Maximum number of years allowed to be carried forward. If not specified, it will impute values from the most recent years available.

    ...

    Arguments passed onto Amelia::amelia() or miceRanger::miceRanger().

    Value

    A dataframe with new variables merged onto the base dataset.

    References

    Egami and Lee. (2023+). Designing Multi-Context Studies for External Validity: Site Selection via Synthetic Purposive Sampling. Available at https://naokiegami.com/paper/sps.pdf.

    Contents

    Developed by Naoki Egami, Diana Da In Lee.
